The Maronite Catholic Church is an Eastern Catholic church that has been in full communion with Rome for centuries. Though they use a different Rite to celebrate the Liturgy than Latin Catholics,they have no substantial theological differences,and thus enjoy good relations with each other. The Maronite Church exists primarily in Lebanon,and is led by the Patriarch of the Levant.

Founded by the prophet Mubarak, a scholar, adventurer, and now the Mahdi who found the truth on the history of the great Judges deep in the ancestral ruins of old Iraq. Mesopotamianism is internally considered an Islamic faith, but are denounced by the wider Islamic world as mushrikun - polytheists, for their reverence of ancestral Mesopotamian gods. Namely, the Mesopotamians revere figures such as Ishtar and Ea, whom they consider to be karubiyin loyal to Allah. They believe that these archangels, now carved into millennia old stones, guided old Mesopotamians before Islam. Under their guidance, the ancient Mesopotamians founded the Empire of Mesopotamia, which ruled the orient for millennia as the one true domain of Allah, until they were shattered by Iblis as revenge for being cast from heaven. The Mesopotamians now believe it is their destiny to restore the ancient empire as the one true ummah and usher in a new golden age.

First spread to India by Saint Thomas the Apostle over 25 centuries ago, the Nasrani sect of Christianity has always been a minority in India. With the chaos of the Event cutting India off from most outside communication, the various Nasrani Churches (both those in communion with the Pope and those in communion with the Eastern Church) united together for the sake of convenience. The example of several holy men has caused the Nasranis to grow in popularity over the last few decades, to the point where they are a majority in Kerala, in the southwestern coast of India, though they are still a minority overall.

More similar to followers a philosophical belief than a religion, Nobelians believe that Knowledge is what drove the people before the Event to greatness. Among those men, the greatest in all the fields of Knowledge were Nobel and his laureates, whose discoveries led humanity forward. However, the Merchant of Death always whispers in the hears of those willing to listen, and so it was that the glory of humanity also created great destruction, until the world was returned to the darkness of ignorance. The Nobelians struggle to return humanity to its former glory, believing they can recreate the greatness of the Old World.

Originating in the distant and unknowable snowlands east of Russia, Razumism is a religion focused on the belief in a phenomenon known as "Mirovoy Razum" by which all human consciousness is thought to be linked. Razumists believe that this world mind is capable of altering human consciousness and the world. This is the origin of spirits with some being the human perspective of concepts and others being the impact humans have left on the collective mind after their death, enabling them to somewhat live on post death. They believe that the Event was caused by the uncontrolled collective mind growing restless and harming humanity. They believe that if humanity is to return to a pre-event stage of advancement it must first mature collectively.

Razumist is a religion from far Siberia, focused on something referred to as 'Mirovoy Razum', a entity connecting all of humanity. It is believed that this entity is capable of influencing both human consciousness and the world. This is the origin of spirits with some being the human perspective of concepts and others being the impact humans have left on the collective mind after their death, enabling them to somewhat live on post death. The religion has been reformed and codified, with a unified set of beliefs and rituals.

Romuva is polytheistic, with a pantheon of gods led by Dievs, god of the sky. Other main gods include Perkunas, god of thunder and lightning, very similar to the ancient Scandinavian god Thor and the Slavic Perun. Other important deities include Saule, goddess of the sun and fertility, Daugava and Meness. After the Apocalypse this ancient religion underwent a renaissance in its number of followers until the majority of the Lithuania, Latvia and Western Belarus were followers of the faith. The Catholics of Nearby Poland could not stand for the heathenry which their once Lithuanian brothers had adopted and they led the charge in a crusade to wipe out the faith in Lithuania once more. By 2555 the religion exists only in a few isolated pockets, largely in secret given the Catholic faith which has reclaimed Lithuania.

The almighty frontier of old America is a harsh, unforgiving place. Endless swathes of prairie gave birth to a deeply spiritual people that inhabit it. The core of Great Plains spirituality is based on worship of the Sky Father - the king of the universe and father of all. The Sky Father is not worshipped like God is in Christian stories, rather he is a concept - the ultimate reality of the universe. The Sky Father is not a god, he is the universe itself, all energy that dwells in it, and all energy that dwells outside of it. Simply, the Sky Father is the reality from which all men, all stars, and all gods are born from - an endless void of energy that all came from and all will one day return to.
Worshippers of the Sky Father believe that when a living being dies, its soul returns to the Sky Father by ascending into Heaven. There is no concept of Hell, only Heaven and the path required to get to it. Thus, elaborate funerals are given to the dead, so that their soul may reach Heaven and not get trapped in the great Frontier - the spiritual inbetween of Heaven and Earth.
Other than the Sky Father himself, many gods are worshipped by the faithful of the Plains, the most important of which being the Earth Mother, who is the Sky Father's wife and who gave birth to the Sun and the Moon. The Sun is the protector of mankind, who will in the great future descend to Earth as a great messiah to bring all the faithful into Heaven, and the Moon is the deceitful, proud counterpart to the Sun, whose existence keeps the universe in balance.
Now, the faithful of the Sky Father come in many names, with their god having many interpretations, and many different rituals, but the core is not lost. Thus, the cowboys of the Plains roam the endless prairie in search of truth, hoping to better understand their god, the universe, some day.

The Zenith are the most ardent worshippers of the transcendental Sky Father, whom they consider the ultimate reality of the universe. As many would agree with them, however, he is not one to speak to his followers, for the Sky Father is a deity beyond human comprehension. Though he exists on a spiritual plane that is unreachable by people, the mortal world as we know is still the great sum of his creation, and everything in it is a shard of the reality of the Sky Father.
There is one spirit that the Zenith consider above mere creation, the love and warmth of the Sky Father enshrined, and it is the Eye of the Father itself - Sol. Without the Sun, there would be no light, no life, and no warmth. The opposite of the Sun's warmth - the Sky Father's other eye - is that of the Moon, which embodies the darkness and death that prevail in the Sun's absence. The Moon is worshipped still, however, as one half of the Father's will manifested - the male reality of the universe being that of the Sun, and the female that of the Moon.
Other than the great eyes in the sky, many spirits are worshipped by the Zenith, as fragments of the Father's divine will. Examples include Pike, the eternal watcher of the great Rockies, and Luis and Clark, great spirits who drag the Sun behind them, riding in a grand ironhorse. The Sun is frequently invoked in lavish rituals meant to bring good health and wealth to the people. The Moon is invoked as well, though not as often, in great funerary proceedings, or for the banishment of evil spirits.
The temples of the Zenith are directly controlled by the Radiant Sun King, an earthly avatar of Sol, and the human conduit of the Sky Father's will. The glory of the Sun and his King are celebrated during the Summer Solstice, an event called the Zenith, the religion's namesake. The Winter Solstice holds a similar festival in the name of the Moon, meant to send the souls of those who died back to the Sky Father.

Rangerites believe that as God reigned in Heaven, Texas reigned in America, manifesting itself as the holy lands projected and honored by the strongest among the faithful. America protected its brood of 50 star-spangled inheritors to its throne by its very nature as the enforcer of law and bringer of prosperity throughout the world.\nHowever, as time passed, America grew swollen and bloodthirsty, the very foundations of its existence eroding due to the weakness of those who were incapable of upholding the divine mandates they inherited from their forefathers, and the unwillingness to correct the mistakes enacted by those who cared not for the sacred or the profane. Eventually, America, once great, died: the subsequent chaos which resulted in her death hardened the hearts of those known now as the Rangerites, who defend the seat of power of Texas and allow her and her alone to survive.\nThe Rangerites, prideful militants to the last, have no love for those who continue to cling to the illusion that America still exists, and views them as lowly worshipers of a divine corpse. Those who continue to defend Texas additionally adhere to those ancient spirits which were neglected in the ancient days, but, with the death of America, now thrive: the Rangerites understand that to honor and worship Texas in the proper way is to honor those spirits of the land which their forefathers neglected, and view themselves as the true inheritors of all the world. Indeed, there is only one state under God, one and indivisible, that will last forever and ever: those who defend it are the last true men in all the world.

The Adaptive Emergency Chain of Command was founded after the Event by the quickly shrinking United States Armed Forces as a strict set of protocols and guidelines for its troopers, in order to keep the Armed Forces alive under any means necessary. They were, however, unsuccessful, losing all control of America for many years to come. However, the descendants of these brave men and women take great pride in their traditions, and are willing to go to great lengths to maintain their faith in the United States of America. Though the different branches of the AECC occasionally have difficulties in seeing eye to eye, they hold great respect for each other in their ageless commitment of upholding the values of Old Glory. The Custodians of America, as they call themselves, no longer stand unified, and many great Generals now seek to unite the bickering Custodites, hoping to reinstate the Northern Command, which would make them the first Commander-in-Chief in hundreds of years. Until then, the Generals swear by their sacred eternal oaths to uphold the Three's Last Orders and keep Lady's Columbia destiny manifested.

The stranded Christians of the northern Great Plains have taken a unique outlook to all the burning questions asked by the trauma of the Event. Giving rise to a new movement of Millenarianism, they believe that the return of Jesus Christ is imminent - and he will rise from nothing to become the prophesied lord of a Heavenly Host. When all the world is under his divine rule, a thousand year utopia will be established, and all the spirits of ages past will be liberated and will return with the faithful to God the Father, where they will be reunited with his heavenly energy. Until then, the Millenarians live simple, humble lives, in familial religious communes, guided by local priests. They wait and watch carefully for the return of their prophesied Saviour, and may God help those who stand against him during the Days of Judgment.

The Exovedes are followers of Louis David Riel, the Prophet of the New World. They claim that long before the Event, Riel was given a vision by God, who instructed him to become the chosen leader of the Métis of Canada, and lead his flock like Moses to a new Israel, their very own promised land. During his time on Earth, Riel gathered the disparate native and Métis masses and professed the new true faith to them. The Exovedate Church reintroduced polygamy, allowed the marriage of priests, reinstituted Mosaic Law, and encouraged circumcision and Saturday Sabbath, though the true faith was all but lost after Riel's execution by the forces of L'Awnfayr. Now, many centuries after the old revolt, the Exovedes gather in the Great Plains, reviving the holy words of their Prophet. They believe that the timeline of the world is split into two halves, each lasting 2333 years. The first 2333 years started in 457 BC, with the mission of Ezra, and ended in 1876, with the birth of Riel. They hold that the apostolic succession of St. Peter was lost with the death of Riel, and it became the duty of the Exovedate Church afterwards to transfer the true Vicariate of Christ to Montréal starting in the year 2333, the Old World Papacy being forfeit, which will begin the age of Métis fulfilment as the chosen tribe of Israel, lasting 1876 more years until the year 4209, which marks the Second Coming of Jesus Christ.

One God, one America, one Texas, three revolutions. These are the words that encapsulate the Lone Star. All followers of the Lone Star believe in a trinitarian conception of one God that includes three aspects: America, Jesus, and Texas. Each of these aspects of the trinity once initiated a great revolution that changed the world, in which the heavens and the Earth briefly merged and chosen men acted as empowered agents of the trinity, invincible and glorious, the true favored sons of God. It is known among these men that while all may become servants of God, only some may become American and only a favoured few within old America had the capacity to become Texan: it is said that while all God-fearing men viewed America with awe, Americans looked towards Texas with similar wonder and reverence. The grit, tenancy, and wealth of those who had total mastery of the land and the skies, and who extract liquid gold from the stones itself were the lords of the world.\nWhile all Lone Star believers pray to God and America in equal measure, it is the recreation of the Lone Star State of being, where all worthy men and women may live within a worldly paradise built by the strong men and women who revolutionised the world thrice over that all desire in their heart of hearts.\nHowever, to unify the strongest and proudest men in all the world, those who worship the old histories and the very lands their herds trot upon and the skies their hawks soar over, is a daunting task: indeed, what generation will produce the finest son of Texas, who can reunite the old treasure-cities and fly the six flags?

Originating in France, the Novelist faith believes that the truth of the origin of the world and all life is not contained in a single book, but is fragmented among the many books that humanity produced. Novelists believe The Novel, the magnum opus penned by Eru l'Auteur and the Valar at the beginning of time, is divided into various ages and revealed, reveals and will reveal itself to the faithful across time. The Novelists believe in a cyclical nature of the world in which the nations of men take different names. They see all other nations to be still clinging to the name of the previous Age, and endeavour to correct this mistake while collecting all works of literature, in hopes they will reveal more of the Novel's content. Additionally, they believe in many figures from these fragments of the Great Novel as being worthy of worship for the role they partook, the worship of these figures varies depending on their importance to the Novel.

The Old Believers trace their founding to an event called the Raskol, long before the Deluge. They maintain that the corrupt Patriach Nikon caused the Raskol by calling for mass reform of the Church, a deed that only could have been commanded by Satan himself. As a result of Nikon's perversions, the Russian Orthodox Church was split into two - the Old Believer churches of the faithful, and the degenerate main Church that eventually devolved into Tsarism, a stain in the eyes of the Lord. The first Old Believers escaped into the remote and inhospitable wilderness of Russia, and when the Earth was destroyed by God, they persisted and reorganised. Now they are formally united in one true Russian Orthodox Church led by the First Hierarch, an elevated priest with limited authority so as to never again cause another Raskol.

Split from the Catholic church in days lost in the mist of time, the Orthodox Church grew to a great extent before the event in the old world, stretching from Greece to Russia. However, After the apocalypse in the americas the Orthodox find themselves a majority faith almost nowhere with what few rulers that do exist struggling to carve out a home in this strange land.

The main branch of the Jewish faith, the Orthodox kept the ancient traditions alive in the changing world before the Event. And once the Event fell upon humanity, more and more Jews joined the Orthodox school, which became the main branch of Judaism once again. Most Jews today are part of the Orthodox faith, and any other is considered an heretic.

Split away from the main Orthodox church in the deep mists of time over the true nature of Christ, the Hay Arak'elakans take the Miaphysite stance as was proclaimed by Saint Cyril of Alexandria, which stated that Christ had a nature which was equally divine and mortal. In the time since the Event, the Church has greatly assisted its Kingdom in holding back the Yarsani tide to the south.

In the final days before the event, the Archangel Raphael sent a vision to a man now known as a great Saint to the Sevillians. It showed him that Rome had become corrupt once more and that the Vicar of Christ should no longer be seated in that wretched city, instead demanding it should be seated in the righteous city of Seville, and if this did not occur a great calamity would befall the world. He attempted to warn the church of the vision, who refused to place their faith in him. In preparation for the oncoming calamity he sought to gather as many followers as possible and establish a new church in the world which would come after, becoming the first Sevillian Pope. When he revealed to the people of Spain that it was the Papacy who had led them to the apocalypse, many of the most fundamentalist Catholics who in the years before the event had grown tired with the growing progressivism of the church flocked to this new church's banners after the event, believing it to better represent the church of old. With all of Spain now following the Sevillian Pope, the faith can now hope to crush the misguided Catholics and their Pope in Rome, and return the world under the shield of the one true church.

Unlike mainstream Tsarism, Petrism states that there are no more Tsars to be blessed in this world. Petrists claim that the unbroken line of Tsars ended with the death of the almighty Peter the Great, Tsar of Man. Petrists adamantly believe that all Tsars after Peter were nothing but imposters, with their degeneracy in life a clear display of falsehood. Tsar Nicholas was a weak and incompetent man, deceived by the demon Rasputin and ultimately killed and consumed by the wicked Lord Stalin, the personification of all evil. The death of Tsar Peter was the death of Mother Russia, with the events that followed culminating in the death of the world itself. Thus, the most important belief of the Petrists is that the apotheosis of Tsar Peter was the last, and will be the last once Peter returns to Earth in flesh to gather the faithful and bring forth a new Great Russia.

Heimwehism is a sect of Lutheranism originating from Germany, which believes that the aggression and pride of the antediluvian peoples destroyed the Old World, dooming all civilisations. Germania, guided by a Kanzler, was one of these civilisations, showing her many faces through the ages, being there to calm her people, giving them freedom like no other, and providing for their needs. But the Devil decieved Germania, giving her delusions of grandeur and a right to rule over the world, and made her unleash her wrath on earth, causing the Event. For this Heimwehist believe they must pay penance for God, to feel the pain the peoples of old felt, preach for peace among everyone, and rid themselves of sin, for one must be a Kanzler of themselves before they can be a Kanzler of Germania.

While Meshicist Judaism in Israel widely accepted the Israeli Monarchy's claim for the title of Messiah ben David, a group of Jewish scholars disagreed with the claim and said that the several descriptions of the Messiah found across Jewish theological texts across the ages conflict with the events that unfolded in Jerusalem. The Mikraists instead believe that the primacy of the older generations of Rabbis cannot be challenged by the current generation of thinkers and thus no contradictions are allowed to arise. The Mikraists seek to find the legendary Mashiach ben Yosef, who they believe is hidden among pious Jews, awaiting to be found and lead the Jewish people to the Messianic Age by cleansing the Land of Israel from evil forces and rebuild a proper Third Temple.

Once a prominent school of thought in Judaism, the Reform faith has since the Event fallen out of favour in most Jewish communities. Today, only a handful of people still preach the idea that the Reform faith is the one true school of Judaism.

The Sikhs trace their lineage to long before the Event, founded the by first Guru Nanak and led by his nine wise successors. The tenth Guru named the Guru Granth Sahib as his eternal successor, the collected writings of the gurus and sants serving as the universal spiritual guide to all Sikhs ever since. The Guru Granth Sahib speaks of one society unified under One God, where all men are free and love each other regardless of their beliefs. Until then, however, the Sikhs do their best to live by their faith with the utmost discipline. The Guru Granth Sahib speaks of the Five Ks that a Sikh must always carry, and the Four Prohibitions that a Sikh must always avoid, and all Sikh societies must follow the Three Pillars as laid down by Guru Nanak. Even the most zealous of heathens hold respect for the Sikh, their temples always being open regardless of faith, and their charities rivalling even the richest kingdoms in their reach.

Leninists are a sect of Stalinists who believe that while the usurpation of Nicholas the Bloody was a just one, it was the great leader Lenin who led a great revolt ordained by the Great Holy Spirit to overthrow the tyrant Tsar who had betrayed the wishes of the Great Holy Spirit. After the defeat of the Tsar at the hands of the revolution, Lenin sought to return his body and divine essence to the Great Holy Spirit only for him to be struck down by Stalin and Trotsky, who wished to steal the Tsar's power for themselves. Stalin kept Trotsky at bay long enough to steal the Tsar's power all for himself, ascending to godhood. The Holy Spirit was enraged at this turn of events and told Stalin that one day, Lenin would reincarnate among the Russian people to destroy him and his followers. Only then under the rule of the Leninov would Russia become a land of peace and prosperity once again.

The Stalinist faith reveres Lord Stalin as the only Tsar worthy of worship as he earned his divinity through his own deeds. Mainstream Zarism came to regard Stalin-worship as heretical early on due to legends that portray Tsar Stalin as having usurped his power from Nicholas the Martyr by killing him with the help of Lenin and Trotsky and consuming his essence, as such the Stalinists were driven away by long years of persecution. Stalinists believe that only through tireless devotion and loyalty can they help Lord Stalin defend the Motherland from its many enemies including the Great Holy Spirit who wishes to bring ruin to all Stalinist realms for Lord Stalin's usurpation. They also believe that similar to their lord they may become divine like a Tsar by consuming the essence of one. Stalin is believed to have been betrayed following his ascension by one of his followers, this traitor attempted to consume Stalin as Stalin had consumed Nicholas. He survived this assault on his being, but was so distraught by it that he saw traitors everywhere and used his divine powers to purge them. It is still debated to this day who this traitor was exactly.

Alevism is a heterodox Islamic tradition, whose adherents follow the mystical Islamic teachings of Haji Bektash Veli, who is supposed to have taught the teachings of the Twelve Imams. Differing from Sunni Islam and Usuli Twelver Shia Islam, Alevis have no binding religious dogmas, and teachings are passed on by a spiritual leader as with Sufi orders. They acknowledge the six articles of faith of Islam, but may differ regarding their interpretation.

Through proselytising to already existing but devastated Muslim communities, the Inayati Order found a base of support amongst them, as well as finding its place as one of the religions of the highways, with its universalist message accessible to anyone, much to the chagrin of the more fundamentalist elements of their communities.

Born from the old Wiccan rites, the Summer Queen trace their heritage back to their founder, the grand wizard Scire, who led a great revival of ancient Arthurian traditions in Britain. The Summer Queen faithful believe that long ago in Avalon, the Queen married a mighty and noble knight. Thus, the Queen was granted eternal dominion over the summer, and the knight became the King of Winter. Their subjects on earth were free to revel under their protection, enjoying celebrations of morris dancing, maypoles, the burning of wicker men, and vast amounts of cider. The Summer Queen grants her followers health and prosperity, while the Winter King protects his subjects from invaders and evil fae using the legendary sword Excalibur, emanations of which are said to still be found in the natural world.

The Barelvi strand of Sunni Islam has been the largest Muslim force in southern Asia for centuries, even before the Old World was struck down. A Sufi revivalist movement, the Barelvi traditionally believe in the light of Muhammad, the belief that the Prophet was one of Allah's first creations, and now exists as light to spread God's knowledge and intercede on the behalf of Muslims. Barelvi rituals include the chanting of dhikr, and the veneration of Muslim saints. Sufi Tariqahs such as the Qadiri, Chishti and Naqshbandi orders are also very popular. With the Muslims of Bangladesh largely turning to syncretism, the Barelvi movement has effectively been reduced to the lands traditionally considered to be Pakistan.
§Y*§! Can venerate ancestors \n§Y*§! Can take several ambitions to remove sins.\n§Y*§! Has a decision to become a Mystic.

The Deobandi revivalist movement has effectively become the biggest rival to the sufist Barelvi movement after the Event. Being opposed both politically and theologically, the Deobandi traditionally reject Sufi practice, not wanting to radically change Islam from its early sharia rules. Despite that, Deobandism is not fundamentally opposed to sufism, believing that it is a fundamental part of Islam and that more esoteric practices like dhikr and Mawlid should be avoided. The Deobandi movement has been greatly influenced by the Wahhabist and Salafist movements to the point where Deobandist rulers traditionally use a form of stratocracy - the ghazwa.

Theosophists are the followers of the Ascended Masters, beings that shepherd the spiritual and intellectual development of humanity. Theosophy was merely one of many foreign esoteric religions to gain a foothold in the British Isles following the Event and the subsequent collapse of the Church. Nonetheless, it was eventually largely stomped out by Thelemites and their Queen. According to Theosophist teachings, it was when the world closed their hearts to the lessons of the Ascended Masters that mankind grew distant from Nature and Truth relying more and more upon false religions before the Old World collapsed under the burden of ignorance and desire that it carried upon its back. Numerous legends hold that a Lord Maitreya will emerge to transfer knowledge about the true constitution and workings of Existence to humankind. Theosophists de-emphasise the importance of organized religious scripture, ritual, and hierarchy as a source of direct enlightenment, viewing them simply as roads for every individual to access the source of Truth. Additionally, Theosophy in the British Isles holds large amounts of influence from the Thelema faith, viewing the Queen as an ascended master in her own right.
§Y*§! Followers of this religion can use the Tarot to divine their future. \n§Y*§! Characters are born under specific Zodiac signs \n§Y*§! Characters can channel specific ascended masters
If I am wise and pious enough I can proclaim myself to be a reincarnation of lord Maitreya.
This character or their ancestor was recognised as Lord Maitreya.
The first step on the road to become an enlightened Ascended Master.
The second step on the road to become an enlightened Ascended Master.
The third step on the road to become an enlightened Ascended Master.
This character has achieved the final stage of spiritual Enlightenment.

This character is channeling Saint Germain, the chohan of the seventh ray, the Hierarch of the Age of Aquarius, portrayed as a diplomat, the embodiment of dignity and statesmanship. Saint Germain is considered responsible for the founding of many civilisations and movements throughout history, including his incarnations as the god-king of the Golden Empire in the Sahara desert, the High Priest of Atlantis, the prophet Samuel, Saint Joseph, the explorer Columbus, and the philosopher Bacon. Following the Event with the heralding of the Aquarian Age his role as the Lord of Civilisation meant he became the main divine force alongside Sanat Kumara responsible for the rebuilding of civilisation and the retrieval of the God flame back into humanity's grasp.

This character is channeling Sanat Kumara, a powerful cosmic being, the Guru of Christ, hierarch of Venus and one of the seven holy Kumaras, said to be the former Lord of the World and the founder of the Great White Brotherhood, the fraternity of Ascended Masters across the world. Theosophists believe that following the Event he stepped down as the Lord with Saint Germain, the Lord of Civilisation taking his place, tasked with bringing the God flame back to humanity, and instead is dedicated to setting his believers on the path of the ruby ray from his domain in the mythical city of Shamballa.

This character is channeling Lady Master Venus, said to be the Divine Complement and Twin Flame to Sanat Kumara. Mankind is said to be her evolution, and she herself came to Earth following the Event to bring the holy flames of civilisation back to humanity. Some Theosophists also consider her to be a goddess of love.

This character is channeling Jesus Christ, the avatar of the Age of Pisces, the Messiah and the incarnation of the Word. During the Piscean age, he revealed the Christ Self to humanity to show the works of the God presence to each human soul. Theosophists believe that following his resurrection, Jesus travelled to Kashmir, where he ascended to the theric city of Shamballa. Following the Event, the Christ consciousness had been lost to many, leading to people turning away from his teachings en masse. Veneration of Jesus is seen with suspicion by the Thelemites, who consider him to be nothing more than an arrogant mystic.

This character is channeling Our Lady of the Stars, the highest Thelemite deity, considered a Master of Ancient Wisdom in Theosophist belief. Following the Event, the Queen ascended to become a Hierarch of the Age of Aquarius, called the Aeon of Ma'at in Thelema, ruling the cosmos while Saint Germain rules the earthly domain. While Thelema belief states that the Queen is an unknowable supreme being, Theosophists believe they can channel her and even contact her telepathically.
As a theosophite i can channel a ascended master to guide my growth.

The Old Thelema faith was mostly abandoned centuries ago by most inhabitants of the British Empire in favour of the current Thelema faith. Old Thelemites claim to be practising their faith as originally dictated by the prophet Crowley. They reject the position of the Lord Protectors as regents of the Queen, considering mainstream Thelemite beliefs to be a perversion of the goddess Nuit. Old Thelemites do not believe Nuit is to return to Earth to rule Britannia, and instead consider the British Empire to be a theologically oppressive state, hellbent on spreading their faith and state to all corners of the Earth, making them no different than the Church. This stance was cause for a massive civil war in Britain in the 23rd century, which led to their marginalisation from society. As such, Old Thelemites only persist in the fringes of Britain, and instead focus their practice on the personal will of the individual, acting to discover their True Will.

The Thelema faith was founded by the great prophet Aleister Crowley long before the Event. With the creation of the new religion, Crowley heralded the new Aeon of Horus, and declared the main principle of Thelema: "Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the law." The Thelemite faith is centered around a pantheon of deities, the main of which is the all-knowing and omnipresent Queen of the Heavens. The Queen rules over the cosmos and is the source of all energy and matter in our world. The central scripture became The Book of the Law, a holy text Crowley claimed to be revealed to him by Aiwass, an entity he considered his guardian angel and which modern Thelemites consider to be a manifestation of the Queen. Before the Event, the Thelemite faithful were ruthlessly pursued by the followers of Jesus on accusations of devil worship, being thrown into obscurity. After the deluge, however, Thelema experienced a massive resurgence in Britain, with the Queen declaring the first Lord Protectors of Britannia to rule the material world in her stead, thereby declaring a new aeon - the Aeon of Ma'at, securing Britannia's eternal dominion over the waves.

Being the largest remaining Jewish community in Europe and the de-facto leaders of the continent's Jewry has made the United Synagogue of Britain one of the most influential institutions in Old World Judaism. Just like Britain of old, the Empire of Britannia has decided to continue recognizing the United Synagogue as an authority in Judaism and has promoted it as an umbrella organization for the myriad Jewish sects dotting Britain. Since then, the United Synagogue has integrated Sephardic congregations and has promoted a more secular lifestyle while keeping with orthodox Jewish traditions. The farthest sects falling under this umbrella are to be found in Russia.

Appealing to the Yiddish speaking masses in the lower classes of British society during the last centuries before the Event, the Federation of Synagogues is a rival institution to the United Synagogue. While the United Synagogue has became more anglified and tends to fund grandiose projects such as cathedral synagogues, the Federationists prefer more communal and intimate congregations. The farthest sects falling under this umbrella are to be found in Russia.

The oldest surviving school of Buddhism, Theravada originates from Sri Lanka, eventually spreading to many parts of Southeast Asia. It is the most conservative and orthodox school, basing itself on the Pali Canon. Its adherents focus on morally upright living and preserving the teachings of the Buddha as they were originally taught.

Traditionally the largest and most popular vehicle of Buddhism in the Old World, Mahayana finds itself a small minority in the diverse lands of the Americas. Mahayana focuses on the importance of the Bodhisattvas, those who compassionate and kind enough to wish for little more than to attain Buddhahood for the sake of all sentient beings. The Mahayana path is one that encourages all people to tread the path of the Bodhisattva as the ultimate ideal in Buddhism, greater than seeking Buddhahood for its own sake, as the only thing greater than being release from suffering yourself is helping those around you to do the same.\nMore esoteric than some other Buddhist yanas, the Mahayana have an elaborate cosmology of many Buddhas and Bodhisattvas existing in many different planes and worlds. The Buddha Shakyamuni remains on Earth out of compassion for the common creature, helping guide Bodhisattvas to enlightenment and guiding everyone to a life without suffering in the celestial Pure Lands of the many Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of this world.

An obscure sect of Stalinism, Titoism holds that the follower who betrayed lord Stalin was the legendary ruler of Yugoslavia Tito. They believe that Tito betrayed Stalin in order to take the power he had stolen and utilise it to free his homeland from the rule of a despotic and malevolent Car. Titoists believe that Stalin did not survive the attempt on his life made by Tito and that Tito went on to free his homeland from the Tyranny of its old Car whom the great Holy spirit refused to strike down itself. Soon after he freed his people the Great holy spirit did battle with him in a great war for heaven, this was for having assisted in the murder of one of its appointed rulers and directly murdering another. This great heavenly war was the event and since that time Tito has been imprisoned in hell by the great holy spirit as he cannot be entirely destroyed given that he contains a fraction of the spirits own power. Only through devotion and loyalty from his small sect can Tito be freed and rule on earth once again.
§Y*§! Rulers can sacrifice infidel prisoners to gain Piety, unlock ritual decisions and the Sacrifice War casus belli

A small offshoot of mainstream Stalinism, Trotskyists believe that Lord Stalin was in fact a traitor to Russia, and that Trotsky, an obscure figure in the Stalinist faith was his betrayer. He is believed to have betrayed Stalin because Stalin was abusing his divine powers, bringing ruin to Russia. Trotsky tried to reason with Stalin, that his power should be turned outward to the other rulers appointed by the Holy Spirit and that they should be overthrown. Stalin would not listen and it is additionally believed by the faith that Stalin was not originally meant to be the consumer of Nicholas when their group plotted his downfall. So Trotsky and others plotted the downfall of what they saw as another weak Tsar. Trotsky managed to consume part of Stalin in his attack, reducing Stalin's power significantly and conversely increasing the power of Trotsky. The two continued to battle continuously despite the damage done to the world, the peak of this being the event itself, yet until all Tsarists and Stalinists are destroyed and only Trotskyists remain, there can be no peace.

For years among merchants and sailors of different cultures and languages stories have been told about the distant lands of Mexico far beyond the Atlantic Ocean, where there is a religious leader protected by the archangel Raphael himself who rules the majority of Catholics from a city located on an island within a great lake. These stories have caused a fraction of Sevillians to come to the conclusion that this man is the true Pope and  that the Holy See was relocated again following the Event, such a revelation means that each and every one of the Christian Churches of the Old World is a vile heresy! As such, the Transatlantics declared themselves representatives of the Pope in Mexico and his council of cardinals, and decided to take it upon themselves to spread the word of the One True Pope.

Cadaverists are a small heretic sect that believe that one of the last Antediluvian Popes is not in fact dead, but can still miraculously speak to members of the higher Cadaverist clergy. It is said that the angel Gabriel came to him during the event and froze his mind within his body to preserve it, as a way to protect him from the calamity. They believe he will some day be restored to his pre-event form once the Cadaverist faithful make up all of the Christian faithful. It is unknown how they came to that conclusion, or how they obtained a corpse in full Papal Regalia. Unsurprisingly enough, the mainstream Catholic Church is not happy about the fact they keep said corpse atop a golden recreation of the Holy See and insisting that it can communicate. Cadaverists meanwhile consider all post-event Church popes to be antipopes, and all other Christians vile heretics who abandoned the Pope, who obviously was blessed by God himself with immortality.
§Y*§! Zealous characters of this faith can declare holy war against Gallicanists

The Vajrayana school of Buddhism is one of the most important pre-Event Buddhist faiths to have survived after the Event. While not as dominant in the 26th century as Gelugpa, the Vajrayana followers still hold it to be the true school of Buddhism.

Salafism is a revivalist movement within Sunni Islam. Originating in Egypt in the shortly before the event, it came to be in defiance of the western world. Moving in step with smaller movements in Najd, Africa, Northern India, and more, just before the event it became a unified movement until the moniker of Salafiya. The name comes from the salaf, the first three generations of Muslims, which is believed to be the unadulterated and pure form of Islam. The Salafis believe that Sunnis should rely on the Quran and the Sunnah alone, while also rejecting any other branch or school of Islam as heretics or even non-Muslims.

Claiming to originate long before the Event, Tsarism is a religion that holds the world was created by a powerful god, the Great Holy Spirit. Though he created the first man, his children were deceived by demons and imposters, and abandoned him. Thus, the Lord bestows his grace and favour to a single temporal ruler, a prophet in flesh - a Tsar. Tsarists hold that the Tsar is blessed by the Lord with heavenly powers, commands the full obedience of his people and, after death, is taken to Heaven to be deified, where they continue to watch over the mortal world from beyond. Tsarists express their piety by praying to the Tsars of yore and going on pilgrimages to their burial sites, while the closest servants of the main Tsars are worshipped as saints, being personally guided by the blessed. Though Tsars are imbued with the Holy Spirit, they are not infallible, and there isn't a more telling example than the story of Lord Stalin, a Tsar who earned his powers by consuming the heart and blood of another, Tsar Nicholas the Martyr, for which he was banished from Heaven.

An ancient religion, Jainism is believed by its followers to have always existed. The religion holds that by following the way of non-violence or 'ahimsa', humans can achieve liberation from the endless cycle of torment and reincarnation, as well as omnipotence, omniscience, and infinite bliss. Jainism used to be a widespread religion in India but dwindled greatly in the centuries before the Event, decreasing to a very small minority. That changed in the post-Event world, where a new order of monks, called the Neeraji, vigorously proselytise for the faith, resulting in a great resurgence of Jainism throughout India.

After the Event, the Hellenic faith has resurfaced. This new form of Hellenism believes that the event was caused by Alexander the Great being reborn as Anaxorgos and overthrowing his father, Zeus. He is the twin brother of Athena, following his rebirth from Zeus' body he convinced many of his younger relatives to rise against Zeus and overthrow him. Ares and Athena were quick to join Anaxorgos, having given him great favour in life as preparation for this battle. When Poseidon took to his brother's defence it was his son Triton, with the aid of his ship and trusty Nereid attendant Averof, who entered battle against the ancient god of the sea and imprisoned him. Persephone convinced Hades to not partake in this familial battle and so he was spared by Anaxorgos due to the aid rendered by Persephone and her Brother Philomelus. It was this great battle between the younger Olympians and those of the older generation which was the event, and said event is evidence of his cousins, siblings and his own destructive power. He now wishes to reclaim his old empire and expand it to encompass the world. The conquest was only halted by the formation of Yugoslavia, but for how long?

After the Event, the Hellenic faith has resurfaced. This new form of Hellenism believes that the event was caused by Alexander the Great being reborn as Anaxorgos and overthrowing his father, Zeus. He is the twin brother of Athena, following his rebirth from Zeus' body he convinced many of his younger relatives to rise against Zeus and overthrow him. Ares and Athena were quick to join Anaxorgos, having given him great favour in life as preparation for this battle. When Poseidon took to his brother's defence it was his son Triton, with the aid of his ship and trusty Nereid attendant Averof, who entered battle against the ancient god of the sea and imprisoned him. Persephone convinced Hades to not partake in this familial battle and so he was spared by Anaxorgos due to the aid rendered by Persephone and her Brother Philomelus. It was this great battle between the younger Olympians and those of the older generation which was the event, and said event is evidence of his cousins, siblings and his own destructive power. He now wishes to reclaim his old empire and expand it to encompass the world. Only the unification of all the Balkan countries in a single nation managed to stop them. Despite the hardship they had to endure, the Hellenists ultimately pulled together and fought back, uniting the faith and its people.

Thammayut is the most wayward school of Buddhism developed after the Event. It placed the emphasis on the goal of spreading the word of Buddha by violence and coercion over traditional pacifism. Strayed far from the original teaching of the Buddha, their monks were barred from a pilgrimage to the holy sites in the Subcontinent. Due to this sanction, it is only a matter of time before they marched west to correct this mistake.

Ariya Maitri was once the flourishing sect in Suvanabhumi, descended from Theravada Sangha of Vientiane and Preah Vihear. In their time, the lord treated the serf as a friend, the harvest was as bountiful and distributed equally. However, that civilised era is long gone. Just like how the Kali-Yuga struck Siam, many disasters have befallen their homeland. The greedy and wicked rose in power and the devoted persecuted. Despite that, many believed that Sri Ariya Meitrai, a Messianic incarnation of Lord Buddha, will come to their aid when the time is right. As such, they held out steadfastly, praying that one day humanity shall be set free from suffering.

What started as Protestantism spread by foreign missionaries long ago, Chinese Christianity later became something of its own. After the event, Christians in China became more isolated from mainstream Christendom. With that, it has adopted ideas from traditional Chinese philosophies and integrated them, forming a unique theology. For example, these Christians pray to their pious ancestors for guidance and believe that a 'Heavenly King' can maintain a Celestial Kingdom on Earth with a Mandate given by God.

There have always been those willing to fight and die for the Folklorist faith, but they have always been scattered and disunited. Now, with the reformation and organisation of the Folklorist faith, a warrior from Archangelsk has decided that these warriors should be gathered into a new order, an army dedicated purely to fighting the enemies of the faith.

For centuries, the Dharmic faith has been beset on all sides, and it has grown very adept indeed at defending itself against powerful external enemies. To this end, its holy warriors have developed a great tradition of hit-and-run fighting, being skilled in attacking enemies from the harsh jungle and retreating before retribution can arrive. Now, with the reorganisation of the Dharmic faith, the Warriors of Shiva have gathered together into a holy order - the Shiva's Executioners, dedicated purely to the defense of the Dharmic faithful against infidels.

The Jadidi religion is a modernist Sunni sect that developed in the Turkic Muslim lands of post-Event Russia. Taking inspiration from the antediluvian movement of the same name, the Jadidiyya are a combination of Islam and Turkic folklore, seeking to preserve Turkic identity in the face of post-deluge chaos and isolation from the greater ummah. As a result, the Jadidiyya venerate pre-Event jadids such as Gasprinsky and Rasulev as saints and exemplar Muslims. What little knowledge of their achievements they have are now incorporated in the form of a modernist outlook on Islam, believing the Qur'an and the Sunnah should be reinterpreted in order for the Turkic identity to survive in this New World.

Across the great Atlantic, centuries before the Event, the mighty deities known as The Founders overthrew the rule of the British, founding the American Republic. Americanists are those who worship these great gods as the true lords of America, and indeed of the whole world. Though this faith originated across the seas, great America had rightful dominion over the entire world, and so they do not refuse the worship of foreigners, if only they will submit to the power of the Great Melting Pot.

Americanism is the faith of the Founding Fathers, those great Gods who threw the British into the Atlantic Ocean. This polytheistic faith has now been reformed, with a proper religious hierarchy established and more accurate and up-to-date holy texts brought over from across the Atlantic.
Magick is respected by the Mages and especially the High Sorcerer. It can be spent for various favours with the mages. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of your ruler.

Krisilaam is a syncretic faith attempting to blend Islam and Christianity together. Born from the syncretic traditions of the Yoruba, Krisilaam only gained widespread influence outside the imperial city of Lagos when the Nigerian Emperors adopted it as the state religion. Created before the Event by a man named Tella Tella, the Krisilaamic holy book, the Iweifeoluwa, merges the core values of the Bible and the Qur'an into five main principles of the religion - love, mercy, joy, good deeds, and truth. The Krisilaamic holy creed states that the God of Muhammad is One, the God of Jesus is One, and Humanity is One.

The Evangelical churches of the Deep South shattered into many independent entities after the Event. Though broken politically, the new Southern churches are united in faith, believing in the doctrine of salvation by grace alone, sola scriptura, and focusing on the conversion experience to Christian life (traditionally known as 'being born again'). With the destruction of the Old World, the Evangelical Protestants believe they are now living in the period known as the Great Tribulation, and it is now their duty to gather the faithful in preparation for the Second Coming.

§Y*§! Practices adult baptism\n§Y*§! Can take ambitions to seek inspiration from biblical passages\n§Y*§! Characters of this faith can freely declare war against characters who are either Greedy, Deceitful, Wrothful, Cynical, Cruel or an Impaler.

Though they claim to be Christians, the Batenburgers possess beliefs that mark them as being well outside the traditional Christian mainstream, believing in their unrestricted right to not only take violent vengeance upon unbelievers, but also to plunder and pillage them by force. Their highly combative nature makes them adept at war, but earns them the ire of their neighbours.

The Episcopal Church in Nigeria, also called the Church of Nigeria, quickly lost contact with their British counterparts during the Event. The Primate of Lagos declared all adherents to wait for further information from the Crown. However, as time went, rumors began to spread that the famed Queen Elizabeth II had passed, and that the Church itself in England was no more. Unwilling to accept such outlandish news, the Primate of Lagos declared himself as the head of the faith until contact with the Crown could be made again. After the fall of the Enwezor dynasty, Episcopalians refused to accept the new Yoruba led Oke-Tude faith and remained steadfast against conversion. For the faithful outside of Nigeria, the Primate can designate pious and powerful rulers as Protectors of the Faith, who serves as the de facto religious head.

The darkest and most alien of all the religions to come out of the West, Occultism regards its gods not as objects of worship, but only of propitiation. They believe that the universe is chaotic and beyond man's comprehension, and that contact with the Gods is sure to drive men mad. Instead, man ought to remain ignorant and comfortable, hidden from the notice of the divine, offering sacrifice only when necessary to lull them back to sleep - though some dangerous men and women dare to flirt with them for esoteric power.

The darkest and most alien of the religions to come out of the West, Occultism regards its gods not as objects of worship, but only of propitiation. The universe is too vast and chaotic for Man to fathom, and only in ignorance lies his safety from madness and the laughter of thirsting gods. To that end, the Occultist religion has been reformed, with a formalised hierarchy taking on the awful burden of learning more about the gods to properly propitiate them and keep them asleep, so that the rest of us may rest more easily at night.
The Lotus-Robed is the Gelugpa Abbot considered most likely to succeed the Dalai Lama.
The Catholicos Expectant is the Apostolic Archbishop considered most likely to succeed the Catholicos.

When the survivors of the Event made their home in the almighty frontier of old Columbia, what they saw was the fallout of a great war - a War in Heaven. The ground littered with the towering automaton corpses of the Father's angelic servants, petrified and frozen in time after their fall. With the fallen angels rebelling against the will of the universe, the Earth below them shook and trembled, the Event raging on and claiming many lives. The only thing left in the aftermath of the War in Heaven was a scarred world, littered with the dead, but a world that is balanced once again.\nThe mighty steel behemoths, angels who died in service of the Lord. The fallen angels who rebelled can be recognised by their deformed, shriveled shapes, and their forms are melted down by the faithful into holy effigies and symbols of power, praying that their souls can be judged and one day redeemed in service of the Father. The angelic faithful, on the other hand, are not to be desecrated, and are instead buried in massive cairns, with elaborate funerary processions, awaiting to one day be called back into Heaven in service of the Steel Father. Now, the Ironhorse encroach ever further east, seeking out the dead and giving them the proper burials they deserve.

The Coptic faith is an ancient Christian church, dating back to millennia before the Event according to its practitioners. They hold the Christological doctrine of Miaphysitism, the belief that Jesus Christ has one nature, that is both fully divine and fully human. The Coptic church, as it exists within the continental United States, has its origins in two far-flung empires which experienced great structural changes in the waning years just prior to the Event, with those peoples who fled being swiftly granted protection by the Federal Government, a relationship which has remained stable for centuries. The Coptic Rite is primarily practiced by the Coptic peoples, who were the Christian peoples of far-flung Egypt, while the Ge'ez Rite was introduced to the Americas by the Ethiopians who traveled to the nation upon the fall of the Emperor of Ethiopia, said to have been a direct descendent of King Solomon. After the Event, the Federal Government fostered the establishment of a Coptic Papacy within its borders, as the Coptic church, while having a strong tradition of autocephaly, held its own Papacy within the fabled city of Alexandria, and accordingly was without strong theological leadership since the Event. Even now, they are largely disunited, with Copt, Ethiopian and Eritrean worshippers, among others, largely remaining beholden to their own dioceses, with day-to-day matters of faith being administered as per the needs of the flock. However, the Coptic Papacy remains a bulwark against those which may prove hostile to Coptic Christendom, as well as as remaining the primary representative of Coptic interests within the Columbian Republican Empire.

The Anglican Church was founded long before the Event by the overseas lords of Britannia, and brought to Canada not soon after. Though all contact with the Anglican Communion has ceased since the end of the world, the Church persists. The Anglicans in Canada now pride themselves on being the middle way between the High Church and Low Church denominations of what remains of the old state, hoping to restore the Church to its former glory, under a new generation of Anglicans led by the Archbishop of Canada.

Originating among Neo-Hussite theologians in Prague after the Event, the Utraquist faith gradually became its own. Having been persecuted by their Catholic overlords for heresy, the Utraquists were driven underground as a faith. However, this persecution only emboldened them more, as many members began preaching secretly in the countryside towns of Central Europe. As a goal, the Utraquists seek to create their own domain, and are eager to spread their beliefs far and wide.

Zaidiyyah, occasionally known as Fiver Shias, is one of the Shia sects closest in terms of theology to the Ibadi and Mutazila schools. Zaidiyyah emerged in the eighth century from Shi'a Islam. Zaidis are named after Zayd ibn Ali, the grandson of Husayn ibn Ali and the son of the fourth Imam Ali ibn 'Husain. Following the event it has attempted to consolidate its position in Yemen in an effort to protect itself during this era of tribulation.

The Ismaili Shi'ites are those who accept Isma'il ibn Jafar as the legitimate successor to Imam Ja'far al-Sadiq, unlike the mainstream Twelvers, who accept his younger brother Musa al-Kadhim. With the devastation caused by the Event, the Nizaris have found themselves stranded in the New World, losing all contact with their Imams in the Old World. Outnumbered and leaderless, the Isma'ilis of America were forced to turn inwards to protect themselves, protecting their few remaining mosques to the last man. When the chaos of the Event came to an end, the Isma'ilis too adopted cosmopolitan ideals, many of them subscribing to the idea that even if the Imamate did not survive as a position, the Mahdi lives on in all of them, and it is the collective duty of mankind to rebuild and forge a New World - one of equity and justice.

The main doctrine of Budaism is that the "Buddha" was not a prince from India, but rather the same person as Buda (or in some texts Bleda), the brother of Attila the Hun. He is believed to have traveled to India after his enlightenment and abdication to his brother. Most of its religious traditions are similar to the Vajrayana school of Buddhism, however it includes some practices that other Buddhists consider pagan.

Egypt has since antediluvian times been a bastion of the Islamic faith, and usually, whomever ruled Egypt was one of the premier powers of the Islamic world, and it is still home to the Al-Azhar University, the premier centre of Islamic learning. Given this importance, the recent incursions by infidels into Egypt have been an intolerable insult to the faithful. In opposition to this outrage, a band of pious warriors have baned together, vowing to dedicate themselves to the fight against the infidel.

Ever since Paulius Juze overthrew the pagan Mindaugasid dynasty centuries ago, Lithuania has been a strong bastion of Catholicism, with the old pagan religion snuffed out so thoroughly that it was difficult to practice it even in private. However, the recent fall of Lithuania to infidels has disgusted many of the zealous locals, who have banded together in an attempt to defend the faith. The new group calls itself 'The Purifiers' as a reference to Paulius Juze's nickname, "Purifier of Lithuania", and promise to fight unbelief everywhere, but especially in Eastern Europe.

Yarsani faith comes from the northwest region of Iran and northern Iraq, it has roots in indigenous Persian faiths like Zoroastrianism, to whom they are closely related. Yarsani believe in the reincarnation of the soul, but also of God, and that in each Epoch there are seven Haftan who accompany God on earth in mortal form. The Last Major presence of God on Earth was Soltan Sahak, who is said to have been born from his virgin mother, and when he grew of age he instructed the Kurdish tribes in the dogma of Yarsan. With the collapse of the world order, the Yarsani have declared it to be the fifth epoch, no longer bound to their mountain lands they strike forth in their search for the next incarnation of God.

The Alawites are an ethnoreligious group primarily in the Levant which originated from Shia Islam. The Alawites revere Ali ibn Abi Talib, considered the first Imam of the Twelver school. The group is believed to have been founded by Ibn Nusayr during the 9th century. Ibn Nusayr was a disciple of the tenth Twelver Imam, Ali al-Hadi and of the eleventh Twelver Imam, Hasan al-Askari. For this reason, Alawites are also called Nusayris. Another name, Ansari, is believed to be a mistransliteration of "Nusayri". In game they are represented as a Druze heresy due to the similarities between the two religions.

Louisiana Voodoo is the most influential African syncretic religion on the Gulf Coast. Descended from West African Vodun and heavily influenced by Catholicism, the core belief of Voudou is worship of the Good God, Bondieu, the creator of the universe, and all life. The fundamental belief is that since Bondieu created life, all things that care for and nourish life are good, showing appreciation for Bondieu and his creations. However, Voudou practitioners do not interact with Bondieu directly, as he is abstract and unknowable. Rather, they work with Bondieu through lesser gods, the lwas, his holiest servants. Lwas are called upon and appeased through sacrifices and offerings, and a lwa is successfully summoned when it possesses a faithful servant, interacting with the mortal world through their body. The most influential lwas include figures like Damballah Wedo, the serpent god who sustains the world, Papa Labas, the holder of the keys to the spirit world, Baron Samedi, the lwa of death and the patron of New Orleans, or Li Grand Zombi, the lwa of all snakes.\nVoudou practice trace itself back to the "rule of the Voodoo Queens" long before the Event, the greatest of which being the Voodoo Queen Marie Laveau, who is often worshipped as a lwa herself. After her death, however, Louisiana Voodoo has been the target of Christian inquisition for centuries, though it has managed to survive and find its place in the new changing world.

The Islam of Central Asia has taken on a unique identity after the Event. This variant of Turkic Islam especially venerates the övlat, holy tribes descended directly from the Prophet through three of the Rashidun, called the Dört Shahriyar, or "four friends" in Turkmenistan - Abu Bakr, Uthman, and Ali. The övlat act as royalty, court shamans, clerics, diplomats, and valuable advisors. Being member of an övlat tribe is immensely prestigious, and they are even reported to have supernatural powers. Other than sufism, the Övlati Muslims also put great value in their ancestral mythology, with archaic epics being retold by wandering dervishes, creation myths written down in books as long as the Qur'an itself, and the wolf being considered a holy creature.

The concept of "sisu" has always been integral to life in Finland. Outsiders consider them nothing more than a disciplined people, but to Finns that discipline is just one of many things necessary to attain good sisu. Sisu is a life force that is innate to all living beings, and it forms a scale with a fragile balance. On one end, bad sisu will make a man corrupted and infirm, while good sisu will give that same man inhuman strength and combat prowess. Upon death, one's sisu will determine whether they ascend to Ylijumala's realm as a deity themselves, or fall into manala and be cursed to suffer for eternity. As an example, Sisuists believe that the Marshal was able to defend Finland against invaders for decades without losing vigor thanks to his good standing in life, while the wicked Lord Stalin was turned into a frail madman as a result of stealing divinity, becoming a cursed god worshipped only by the insane.

The "Igreja Romariana", or "Romarian Church" is the legal successor to the Catholic church of Brazil. After the chaos of the Event, many Brazilians abandoned the Church, believing that Rome is gone, and with it the Pope. A small, but dedicated number of Sedevacantist Catholics held out, believing the Pope was simply too far to contact. Centuries passed, and the Romarian Church became the dominant Christian faith in most of Brazil, having absorbed many schismatic churches that rejected the Pope in Rome. It only grew to widespread prominence when the kings of Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo, Espírito Santo and the dukes of Alagoas, Rio Grande do Norte and Sergipe agreed to adopt it as part of their temporary alliance. By 2555, contact with Rome has been reestablished, and the Patriarch of Aparecida sits as the formal head of Brazilian Catholicism as contacting the Pope in Rome requires a perilous journey across the Atlantic. All adherents east of the Atlantic Ocean answer to the Archbishop of Cabo Verde, who in turn serves as the intermediary between the Pope and the Patriarch. Romarians reject the Sevillian Pope, believing him to be yet another schismatic like the ones that were struck  down in Brazil many years before.

Less of a religion and more of a philosophy, the Way represents the Blorg ideals of Fanatic Xenophilia and Militarism. Having been heavily influenced by human culture during the formative years of their civilization, the Blorg hold great respect for the native cultures of Earth.

Nupolona-kolon (roughly meaning "Elder's Teachings") is the umbrella term of the syncretized system of Liberian native beliefs and Protestant Christianity widespread in Liberia. Most Nupolona-kolon faithful follow either the more native focused Old Ways or the more Christian influenced New Ways.

Ahl-e Haqq, which translates loosely to the people of truth, is a movement within Yarsanism to move closer to Islam and adapt to the political climate of the middle east. However, this movement did not go unnoticed, branded heretics by the mainline faith or Yarsani, they distance themselves from their puritanical parent faith on the path of reformism.

After the introduction of Buddhism to Tibet, Bön adopted many of its elements. It has perserved through the event and the centuries after in a number of communities protected from the event by the Thunder Dragon Empire and in several valleys throughout Tibet.

Korean shamanism, also known as Shindo, Mushindo or Muism, is the ancient animistic folk religion of Korea. It is said that in the years before the Event, a great War in Heaven took place between the Tyrannical Ruby Chairman and a mighty Dragon King, the culmination of which led to the near end of the world and the subsequent release of incredible amounts of spirits and energy into the world. Over time, this led to a large rise in the number of followers of shamanism in Korea, who now consider their task to be understanding and appeasing the many spirits released into the world. Korean folk beliefs include a wide variety of gods, spirits and supernatural beings, and shamans, known as mu, have an important role in their society. Shamans are chosen through a process known as shinbyeong, which the Shindo believe to be possession by a god and subsequent loss of self. Korean mythology largely differs from area to area, being mainly orally retold in the form of shamanic narratives and creation myths in rites known as gut, along with offerings to gods and spirits and rituals of song and dance.

The Ryukyuan folk religion, also known as Shinko or Ryukyu Shinto, is the ancestral belief system of the Ryukyu islands, consisting of many deities, spirits and mythological creatures. Syncretic in nature, the Ryukyuan religion has over the centuries been influenced by a variety of religions, mainly Buddhism and traditional Chinese faiths like Taoism and Confucianism. The Shinko believe in the existence of mabui, a form of spirit or soul integral to every person, being their very essence and defining characteristic. At the center of Shinko worship are their Ultimate Ancestors, those being Utin (the father), Jiichi (the mother), and Ryugu (the sea), as family and reverence of ancestors are highly emphasised in Ryukyuan religion. Though not explicitly shamanistic, mediums and healers known as the kaminchu have an important role in their faith. Especially important are the female kaminchu, known as the noro, who formally act as priestesses and caretakers of Shinko temples, at times even acting as important political figures or priestess-queens.

Shinto is the main faith of Japan. This polytheistic faith revolves around Kami, spiritual entities that exist in all things. The various Kami are revered in shrines and the most important ones have extensive temples built for them. Shinto priests, called kannushi, celebrate Kami with kagura dances and seasonal festivals, ensuring their continued protection over their land. While all Kami receive some form of reverence, even if only in the form of small shrines, it is undeniable that certain Kami, such as Amaterasu or Ebisu, are more revered. After the Event, the role of Yokai, monstrous spirits, has grown into Shinto, the spirits becoming known as entities that are believed to hold negative influence over the world and thus opposed to the Kami. Divided into Mamono, Mononoke, Ayakashi and other groups, Yokai are greatly feared by Shinto followers.

Western Shinto is a recent branch of Shinto that has developed through the influence of Amida Shinto over the Shinto practices of Shikoku and easter Chugoku. This faith places emphasis on the defense and unity of the Shinto followers of Japan, believing that, if Japan is unified and isolated, the Kami will celebrate this unity by bestowing their protection upon the land, granting bountiful harvests and health to the land, so long as its followers do not try to extend themselves upon other people. Western Shinto followers particularly fear the water spirits known as Ayakashi, and Seiryu, the eastern blue dragon that is said to have once punished Japan for its hubris and cruelty by destroying two of its greatest cities, and as contrast follow particularly Bishamonten and his companions, the Seven Gods of Fortune or Shichifukujin, and the gods that once shielded Japan from an invasion, Fujin and Raijin.

Amida Shinto developed after the Event from the syncretization of the teachings of the Buddhist schools of Japan and the Shinto faith. In the Amida Shinto faith, the Buddha Amida plays a central role, and most of the religious practice of the faith are modeled on the pre-Event rites of the Buddhist schools, but the faith also emphasizes the role of Kami in the protection of the faithful. The faith conflates Yokai and Preta, often referring to one and the other interchangeably.

Northern Shinto developed by the union of Buddhism, Shinto and the surviving Ainu folklore of the island of Hokkaido. Northern Shinto practicioners refer to the Kami as Kamui, revere Amida among them, but also particularly honor certain Kamui that in other parts of Japan are not as celebrated, some coming from Ainu folklore such as Ape-Kamui, the fire spirit that guards the households through winter from some of the Yokai that bring cold and death, such as the Yuki-Onna.

Taking the name from the early followers of Christianity from Japan, the Kirishitan movement is a unique post-Event church formed by the surviving children of God in Japan. Overtime, the faith has developed unique aspects, such as having strong Buddhist influences in its rituals. In addition, they also have a strong sense of saint veneration, such as reverence for the Buddha Amida as a saint.

The beliefs of the Isukirian faith diverge greatly from all other Christian faiths, mainly because of their belief that not only did Jesus go to study in Japan, but Jesus also escaped crucifixion with his brother Isukiri taking his place instead. After that he returned to Japan in which he made a family and lived a long life.

Adat Bungan is the name for the ancient folk religion of the Kenyah and Kayah peoples of Borneo. According to legend, before the Event the people of Borneo were forced to convert to a foreign religion by force, with their old customs dying out as a result. However, a prophet by the name of Jok Apoi was given a vision from the goddess Bungan who requested their old faith be revived and reformed. With many old taboos and superstitions phased out, the traditions of central Borneo were saved from extinction. The Bungan faith is centered around a pantheon of deities called bali, with the highest bali being Pelegain. Other gods below him include Pesalong, the bali who created humans and other minor deities and protector spirits. To adherents, the most important of these is Bungan, whose intercession is sought by raising an egg into the sky.

It is believed that during the Tiwah festival, which lasts for 30 days, you can offer blessings to him by sacrificing livestock, as an offering to him and other smaller gods.

The Wokou faith is a faith that spread through the Pacific and the eastern Indian Ocean. Popularized by the Chinese and Japanese pirates, the faith believes in the protection of various sea gods from all over the oceans of the region. While it lacks any form of organization, the faith is not quite as disorganized as the western [brethren.GetName].

Known as Pure Land Buddhism or Amidism, Jodo Bukkyo is a branch of Mahayana Buddhism practiced in the distant land of Japan. In the New World, its practitioners have managed to survive in Canada, for now at least. Jodo Bukkyo focuses on the teachings and the figure of the Buddha Amida. The faith believes in the Pure Land created by the Buddha Amida by expounding his Dharma, a region offering respite from karmic transmigration. Those that enter the Pure Land are thought by Amida until they can achieve proper enlightenment.

Cao Ðài, full name Ðài Dao Tam Ky Pho Do meaning The Great Faith for the Third Period of Redemption, is a syncretic movement born in Vietnam. Their beliefs draw from many different sources: ethical precepts from Confucianism, occult practices of Taoism, theories of karma and rebirth from Buddhism, and hierarchical organisation of Catholicism. The Cao Dai believe that in the ancient antediluvian age, a man named Ngo Minh Chieu was given a vision from the Divine Eye of God and was told to spread the faith far, as man will not find universal peace without one universal faith. They claim that many men have been given the will of the Highest Power throughout history, though their words have since been perverted by their followers. As a result, they revere many religious leaders, such as Jesus, Mohammed, and Buddha, as saintly figures. In the days after the Event, however,  the Cao Dai have long struggled with persecution from the Red and Yellow Emperors. The Caodaist Church has since cut all ties with rulers of both empires and turned inwards in an act of self-preservation, though it remains to be seen if its followers would choose the Empire or their faith.

Nihongjiao or the Neon Cult venerates Xihe, an ancient Sun Goddess long forgotten. When the Old World grew Decadent and Foul Xihe awoke from her long Slumber to cleanse the world and be reborn. She gave birth to ten Suns in the form of three legged crows, causing the world to burn. But before the world was cleansed and Xi´He reborn , Shen Yi ,the husband of the Moon Goddess Chang'e, shot nine of the ten crows down, preventing the rebirth of both the World and the Goddess. When the first of the Nihongjiao faithful emerged they came across curious trinkets which seemed to illuminate under specific circumstances, believing they had found fragments of the souls of the nine lost suns the faithful soon developed intricate ceramic vessels which allowed them to communicate with the fragments. For over a hundred years now the believers have amassed these trinkets at the center of their holy city in Shanghai constructing an enormous effigy of their Goddess, waiting for the day when all the fragments are reunited as one and Xihe will be reborn as the Neon Goddess to set the world ablaze.
